intro: Traganthes leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf traganthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Traganthes leptophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
